text:
V. An Account of a Book, Entitled,

*Hortus Medicus Amstelodamensis, sive Plantarum tam Orientalis quam Occidentalis Indiae aliarumque peregrinarum Descriptio & Icones.* Autore Joanne Commelinus Urbis Amstelod. (dum viverit) Senatore. Et latinitate donatum, Notis & Observationibus illustratum a Frederico Ruysscho, M. D. Botar. Profess. &c. & Francisco Kiggelario, Amst. 1697. Fol. And to be sold by S. Smith, and B. Walford, in St. Paul's Church-Yard.

With many additional Remarks by J.P. Fellow of the Royal Society.

This Work is none of the least Specimens of Modern Magnificence and Improvement in the History of Nature, which though she opens daily such Mines and Treasures, yet is never like to be exhausted. The Art of Calcography has given to these Studies a new sort of Life and Perspicuity; the Beauty and Graces whereof, have drawn many Illustrious Persons abroad, into a kind of Emulation who should excel in this Noble and most useful Ornament: What the English want in this Part, they have made up in their Critical Methods in their Discoveries of Non Descript Species, and in their judicious References to the Synonimous Names of various Writers, whereby the terrible Vices of Confusion and Multiplicity have been very much corrected. For this I need name no more than a Worthy Member of the Royal Society, who has been pleas'd to shew such an admirable Skill and Talent this Way, as will hardly be match'd either in past, present, or future Ages.

The Authors of this Garden have here described and elegantly Figured above a Hundred several Plants, which take in order, with the Illustrations of many additional Synonima, not mentioned by the Curious Publishers.

1. Ranunculus *Ethiopicus* foliis rigidis, floribus ex luteo virescentibus *H. Amst.* p. 1. Tab. 1. perelegans *D. Franqueville*, foliis aculeatis *Lob. illuf.* 135. Imperatoria Ranunculoides *Africana* enneaphyllos, Lasertitii lobatis foliis rigidis margine spinosis *Pluk.* Tab. 95. Fig. 2. Sphondilii Panacis rigido hirtiq; folio Planta Africana, caustica *P. R. P.* Umbellifera urens Capitis bonæ spei *Alm. Bot.* 198.

2. Alcea Carpini folio Americana frutescens, flosculis luteis semine duplici rostro donato *H. Amst.* p. 2. Tab. 2. Vigimiana Carpini folio flosculis minimis luteis semine duplici rostro f. aculeo predito *H. Ox.* 528. S. v. Tab. 35. Fig. ult. Althea *Virg.* bidens
bidens Pimpinellae majoris acutiore folio, flosculis minimis luteis Pluk. Tab. 9. Fig. 6.

3. Chrysanthemum Americanum caule alato, flore aphylo globoso Aurantio foliis Baccharidis H. Amft. p. 5. Tab. 3. cannabium Americanum alatum fl. aphylo globoso aurantio Baccharidis foliis Brey pr. 2. Amer. bidens alatum fl. parvo aurantiaco Pluk. Tab. 84. Fig. 3. Conyzoides caule alato Curassavicum P. B. P. Conyz. Curass. Abrotani sem. flore aurantio ejusd. Sl. Cat. Plant. Jam. 126.

4. Portulaca Americana latifolia erecta, floribus albis H. Amft. p. 7. Tab. 4. & P. B. P. affinis Amer. tricapsularis erecta fl. albo, pediculis angulosis Pluk. Tab. 105. Fig. 6.

5. Portulaca Curassavica angusto longo lucidoque folio procumbens, floribus rubris H. Amft. p. 9. Tab. 5. & P. B. P. Alm. Bot. 303. Amer. procumbens longo levique folio glauco, flore pulpureo pulchro Anagallidis Breyn. Prod. 2.

6. Blattaria Zeylanica flore ampio miniato Cat. H. Amft. Ceyl. fl. ampio coccineo H. Ejusd. p. 11. Tab. 6.

7. Linaria Lusitanica procumbens polygoni folio, fl. pallido-ceruleo rictu luteo H. Amft. p. 13. Tab. 7. & Cat. ejusd.

8. Convolvulus Americanus pilosus, fl. luteo, umbone purpureo H. Amft. p. 15. Tab. 8. Africanus, sive Guineensis pumilis Sagittae foliis fl. campanulato obsoleti luteo fundo purpureo-rascente H. Beam.

9. Ricinus Americanus perennis, floribus purpureis, staphid. agria foliis H. Amft. p. 17. Tab. 9. Indicus pilosus trifidus vel quinquifidus flosculis atro purpureis in umbella aggregatis Pluk. Tab. 56. Fig. 2. Brasilianus perennis fl. purp. sol. Staph. non-nihil simili P. B. P. Amer. sol. Staphisagriæ C. B. 442, & 518. minor Staph. sol. fl. pentap. purpureo Sl. Cat. Plant. Jam. 41. Wild Cassada Jamaicensibus.

10. Ricinus Tithymalodes Americanus lactescens & urens floribus albis H. Amft. & P. B. P. lactescens Fici foliis spiaulis mordacibus armatis Pluk. Tab. 220. Fig. 3. Frutex innominatus pungens & urens Marcgr. p. 79. Fig. Brancamos Lusit.

11. Euphorbium Cerei effigie caulibus crassioribus spinis validioribus armatum Breyn. pr. 2.

12. Euphorbium antiquorum verum H. Amft. p. 23. Fig. 12. Tithymalus Indicus Spinofus & angulofus lacte turgens acri H. Beam. T. aizoides triangularis nodosus & spinofus lacte turgens acri Alm. Bot. 370. Schadida Calli H. Mal. V. 2. Tab. 42. p. Pada Nivuli Bram. Sidera Calli Zeyl. Ray H. Pl. 878.
13. Tithymalus Indicus arborecens spinosus, Nerii folio H. Amst. p. 25. Tab. 13. Zeylanicus spinosus arborecens P. B. P. & Append. Pluk. Tab. 230. Fig. 4. Euphorbia & Tithymal. media affinis aizoides indica arb. spinosa Nerii folio Breyn. Pr. 2. Ela-calli H. Mal. V. 2. Tab. 43. p. 83. Niculi Bram. Raii H. Pl. 1888.

14. Tithymalus Indicus frutescens H. Amst. p. 27. Tab. 14. & Raii H. Pl. 1710. ramosissimus frutescens penè aphyllus P.B.P. arborecens caule aphylllo Pluk. Tab. 219. Fig. 6. aphyllus Planta Mauritanica Imperati 664. Fig. Tiru-calli, H. Mal. V. 2. Tab. 44. p. 85. Portigalli vivuli Bram.

15. Tithymalus Arboreus Americanus Cotini folio H. Amst. p. 29. Tab. 15. & Cat. Eufeld. Curassavicus folio Cotini Massinilia Sylvestris P. B. P. Curass. fol. Cotini triphyllos petalis floscolorum serratis Alm. Bot. 369. Pluk. Tab. 230. Fig. 3. Sirinamenis arborecens Cotini f. Coccigriae folis & facie Breyn. Pr. 2.

T. vel T. affinis f. similis aphyllus dictus, major indicus latifolius fl. Sanguineo aviculae capitulum representante Breyn. Pr. 2. T. similis frutescens Amer. Myrtifolius fl. disformi rubicundo Cat. H. Amst.

17. Planta lactaria Africana H. Amst. p. 33. Tab. 17. Tithymali fortè genus Planta lactaria Africana Pini fructuum facie Breyn. Pr. 2. an T. Æthiop. aphyllos verrucosus rad. tuberosa H. Amst.

18. Alcea Bengalensis spinosissima Acetosae sapore, fl. luteo pallido umbone purpureascente H. Amst. p. 35. Tab. 18. spin. Madraßatana foliis profunde laciniatis Cannabis in modum pentaphyllea saporis acidi Pluk. Tab. 5. Fig. 4, Indica spinosa magno flore ex albido flavescente Com. in H. Mal. A. Acetosa Indica spinosa, foliis profunde laciniatis flore subluteo ampio Breyn. Pr. 2. Althea indica spinosa Acetosae sapore fl. flavo pendente P. B. P. Zeylan. foliis alperis profunde laciniatis foliorum Cannabis instar saporis acidi H. Leyd. p. 27. Acetosa indica Bontii p. 113. Fig. Narinam-pulli H. Mal. V. 6. Tab. 44. p. 75. Ambetti Brach. Fula Gafinbola Lusit. Krabben doorn Belg. Nelta Hen. van Rheede. Raii H. Pl. 1901.

19. Alcea Americana annua fl. albo maximo, fructu maximo pyramidalis sulcato H. Amst. p. 37. Tab. 19. annua Sirinamenis
mensis fl. ampla, fr. max. sulcato, striato pyramidali Cat. H. Amft. Brasilianum fr. max. pyram. sulcato Alm. Bot. max. Malvae Roseae fol. fr. decagon. recto crassiore breviore esculentum Sl. Cat. Pl. Jam. 98. Ochroa, Okkoro, & Kinkanbau Surinam. & Okra Jamaicensibus dicitur.

20. Citrus Ledon flore maculâ nigricante notato H. Amft. p. 39. Tab. 20. I. B. V. 2. L. 13. p. 8. Fig. Chabr. 97. C. Led. Launinis foliis angustioribus fl. albo, unguiculis petalorum purpureis Alm. Bot. 101. Ladaniæ Hispanica incana CB. 467. Ray H. Pl. 1009.

21. Oxys bulbosa Africana rotundifolia, caulibus & floribus purpureis amplis H. Amft. p. 41. Tab. 21. an bulb. Afr. rotund. fl. purp. ampla Breyn. Pr. 2? affinis Planta bulbosa Afric. fl. purp. magno Eujd. Cent. c. 46. p. 102. Fig. Afr. fl. purp. magno rad. bulbosa H. Leyd.

22. Oxys bulbosa Æthiopica minor fol. cordato fl. ex albedo purpureacente H. Amft. p. 43. Tab. 22. an Afric. fol. & flore parvo albente rad. Alphoeli P. B. P. Trifol. bulbosum fl. albo Promont. bona spei Bod. a Stapel in Theophr. 336.

23. Nerium latifol. Indicum fl. variegato odorato pleno H. Amft. p. 45. Tab. 25. & H. Leyd. Ind. fl. rubescente pleno Breyn. Pr. 2. Ind. Latifol. fl. rubro & aliquando variegato pleuo H. Bean. Fula mestica Zeylonensi.

Amaranthoides Indicum monosperrum, foliis Ocymastri capitulis purpureis P. B. P. Gnaphalio affinis Ocymastri folio, flore ex purpureo violaceo H. Bof. & Leyd. Wadapou H. Mal. V. 10. Tab. 37. p. 73. Gondo Bram. Wadambu Zeyl. Fulo Buton Malais.

49. Aloe arborescens Africana H. Beam. &c H. Amst. p. 93. Fig. 49.

50. Arum *Ethiopicum* fl. albo odorato H. Amst. p. 95. Fig. 50. Eth. fl. albo odorato, Moschum redolente H. Leyd. Afr. fl. albo odorato P. B. P.

53. Arum Ceylanicum, polyphyllum, caule aspero, maculis viridis fulcis, viridi dilutis & albicantibus pulchre notato H. Amst. p. 101. Fig. 53. A. Polyphyllum Dracunculus & serpentaria dictum Ceylonicum caule alpero cum maculis viridi fulcis & viridi dilutis albicantibus pulchre notatum, majus & elatius Cat. H. Amst.
H. Amst. an A. polyph. Dracont. & Serpent. dictum folio ramoso Paeonia instar caule aspero Zeylanicum P. B. Pr.

Leyd. major feminibus alb. H. Leyd. app. 663 pun. Indic. fr. majore ex flavo rubente Com. Not. in H. Mal. Momordica Ceyl. fr. fr. major ex flavo rubente sem. albis H. Beam. Pandi-Pavel H. Mal. V. 8. Tab. 9. p. 17. Valli carati Bram. Maragosa & Folhas Margoseira com fructa grande Lusit. Groot Bierblad. Belg. Poncleii Benghal.

Leyd. app. Echinomelocactos minor lactescens absque tomento cylindris strictioribus P. B. Pr. tuberosus, f. globularis minor ex Hort. Fagel. Sch. Bot. 33. Opuntia Echinomelocacti effigie tuberosa, fructu levissimo Amethystino Breyn. Pr. 2.

56. Ficus Indica f. Opuntia Curassavica minima H. Beam. &c. H. Amst. p. 107. Fig. 56. F. I. minima spinis brevissimis munita ex Hort. Fagel. Schol. Bot. 33. Opuntia Americana minima spinis creberrimis tenuissimis Breyn. Pr. 2. an minima Indica H. Pisani? Forte etiam Ficus. Ind. omnium minima, spinulis tenellis undique armata ex Virginia Alm. Bot. 147. The Pin-pillow.

Fig. 58. an Palma Americana non spinosa crassis rigidique foliis, caudice scabro in caput protuberante P. B. P? an P. Amer. foliis Polygonati brevioribus leviter serratis & nonnihil spinosis trunco crasso Breyn. Pr. 2? & Pluk. Tab. 103. Fig. 2. & Tab. 309. Fig. 5?

anollibus atq; deciduis Breyn. Pr. 2. & rectius Abies Virg. foliis mollibus Mimosa atq; deciduis Ejusd. Cup. Virg. H. Tradescant. Virg. foliis Acaciae deciduis H. Leyd. Tlalocan f. Cupressus Amer. sula. Hern. 98. (ex sent. D. Pluk.) & Raii H. Pl. 1933. Cap. 80. Cupr. Amer. an Thuia Theophr. Cupresso similis cujus fructus Habbel huic assimulatur Park. 1477. Fig.

Fig. Salix Brasiliensis 2da. capitulifera Johnst. Dendr. 446. Tab. 126. Alnus maritima Myrtifolia Coriariorum Button-wood Bermudensis vulgo Pluk. Tab. 240. Fig. 3. Alni fructu Laurifolia arbor maritima Sl.Cat. Plant. Jam. 135. Alno affinis Americana Ligustri folio, fructu spicato rubro Breyn. Pr. 2. & Pluk. Tab. 128. Fig. 2. Jamaica Button-Tree.

61. Nux Zeylanica Juglandis folio P. B. P. & H. Amst. p.117. Fig. 61. Domba-Geddy Zeylan.

62. Ficus Bengalenfis folio subrotundo, fructu orbiculato H. Beam. Americana latiori folio venoso ex Curacao Pluk. Tab. 178. Fig. 1. an F. Indica fol. oblongo obtulo fr. minore pallide luteo sphærico Sl.Cat.Plant.Jam. 189. an F. arbor Barbadenfum Ligonis p. 69. Peralu H. Mal. V. 1. Tab. 28. p. 49. Vadhoè Bram. Pipal. Benghal. Ficus. Malabarenfis fol.craffiufulculo, majori, fructu gemino intenfe rubente Com. not.

63. Gujava alba dulcis P. B. P. & H. Amst. p. 121 Fig. 63. alba acida fr. rotundiori India Orient. Pluk. Tab. 193. Fig. 4. Guayava Ger. 1612. Fig. id. em. 1612. Fig. Park. 1634. Fig. Indica fructu mali facie pulpa interiore alba I. B. Var. V. 1.L. 1. p. 108. Fig. fals. & Chabr. Var. p. 5. Fig. fals. Guajabo pomi-fera Indica pulpa candida CB. Var.437. & Guajanos in Hilpania nova, &c. Ejusd. 441 Pela & Pelouka Mal. Pera Brach. Guajasas seu Peera Lusit. Goejaves Belg. H. Mal. V. 3. Tab.34. p. 31. The large white Guava.

64. Vitis Idea Æthiopica Myrti Tarentinae folio, flore atro purpureo H. Amst. p.123. Fig. 64. an Frutex Æthiopicus baccifer foliis Myrtilli Breyn. Cent. p. 9. c. 5. Fig.

65. Vitis Idea Æthiopica Buxi-minoris folio, floribus albi-dis H. Amst. p. 125. Fig. 65. an Frutex Æthiop. baccifer fol. Myrtilli alter Breyn. Cent. p. 10?

66. Amaranthus baccifer Circeae foliis H. Amst. p. 127. Fig. 66. bacc. Indicus minor Circeae folio & facie H. Beam. 1. femine
femine & facie Americana foliis Circeæ P. B. P. & Helitropium Curassavicum Scammonii foliis mollibus subhirsutis Eju/d. Amer. majus foliis Populæ nigrae languinosis fl. albo minimo Breyn. Pr.2. & Monophyllum Amer. Circeæ foliis & facie fl. albo parvo Eju/d. Pr. 2. Selanum racemosum Americanum minus Sl. Cat. Plant. Jam.85. Barbadoense racemosum minus tinctorium Circeæ foliis mollibus & incanis Pluk. Tab. 112. Fig. 2. an Seconde plante guerissante le mal des dents Du Tertre p. 92?

67. Malus Americana trifolia, fructu pomi Aurantii instar colorato. Arach Simmeron vulgò H. Amft. p. 129. Fig. 67. an Anona trifolia, flore stamineo, fructu Sphærico ferrugineo scabro minore Allii odore Sl. Cat. Plant. Jam. 205?

68. Malus Americana Laurocerasi folio venenta, Mancinello arbor seu Massimilia dicta H. Amft. p. 131. Fig. 68. Juglandi affinis arbor julifera lactescens venenata Pyrifolia, Mancanilla Hispan. dicta Sl. Cat. Plant. Jam. 129. The Manchaneel Tree.

69. Anona H. Amft. p. 133. Fig. 69.

70. Malus Americana spinosa, Portulacæ folio, fructu foliolo, femine reniformi splendente Blad-appel vulgò. H. Amft.p.135. Fig.70.

71. Arbor Americana Cucurbitifera, folio longo mucronato, fructu oblongo H. Amst.p. 137. Fig. 71. A. Cucurb. folio longo mucronato f. Laurino Raii H. Pl. 1668. Cucurbitifera arbor Americana, folio longo mucronato fructu orbiculari, gronis cordiformibus pulpa nigra involutis Pluk. Tab. 171. Fig. 1. Laurifolia Guineensis CB 461. Arbor folio Lauri fructu Cucurbitæ 1. B. V. 1. L. 1. p. fol. Lauri ex Guinea Chabr. 5. Fig. transposita.

72. Sebestena domestica CB. 446. & H. Amft. p. 139. Fig. 72. Sebesten Park.252. Fig. Seb. Myxa sive Myxaria Ger.1315. Fig. id. em. 1499. Fig. Domestica Alp. Ægypt. 12. Fig. Myxa domestica f. Seletten IB. V. 1. L. 2. p. 197. Chabr. 12. Fig. Prunus Sebestena Mattbioli H. Lugd. & Pluk. Tab. 217. Fig. 2. The true Sebesten or Assyrian Plumb.
